conclusion: Analyze velocity-time graph of objects A and B to determine acceleration of object B from t1 to t2.
Initial conditions: Both objects start from the same position at t = 0.
Velocity-time graph for object A shows increasing velocity over time, starting from v = 0 at t = 0.
Velocity-time graph for object B shows decreasing velocity over time, starting from v = 0 at t = 0.
Since velocity of object B decreases over time, acceleration must be negative.
Graph shows object B's velocity decreases from t1 to t2.
Acceleration of object B must be decreasing over interval from t1 to t2.
Since graph is a straight line, slope of velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
Acceleration of object B decreases from t1 to t2.
Trend of acceleration of object B during time interval 0 to t2 is decreasing.
Final answer: Trend of acceleration of object B during time interval 0 to t2 is decreasing.
